popt4jlib.neural.costfunction

Class MAE

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.neural.costfunction.MAE
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FunctionIntf, FFNNCostFunctionIntf

    public class MAE
extends java.lang.Object
implements FFNNCostFunctionIntf
    implements the Mean Absolute Error (MAE) function.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2020

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double eval(java.lang.Object arg, java.util.HashMap params)
      computes and returns the value (|x_1|+|x_2|+...+|x_n|)/m where m is the number of non-NaN components of x.
      double evalDerivative(double x, int num_insts)
      computes the value 1 or -1 depending on the sign of the argument.
      double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] d_per_instance)
      computes the partial derivative of this function on an array of values that is the derivative of this function on a set of training instances and labels.
      double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] weights, int index, double[] input_signals, double true_lbl, java.util.HashMap p)
      evaluates the partial derivative of the entire network's cost function (as a function of its weights) with respect to the weight variable whose weight is given by the value of the weights array in the given index.
      double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] weights, int index, double[] input_signals, double true_lbl, int num_insts)
      same as evalPartialDerivativeB(weights, index, input_signals, true_lbl, p) but uses the thread-local grad-vector caches instead of the last deriv cache (also uses the last-eval thread-local cache)
      FFNN4TrainB getFFNN()
      returns the network this function is set be part of.
      void setFFNN(FFNN4TrainB f)
      set the network this function is part of.

      • evalPartialDerivativeB

        public double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] weights,
                                     int index,
                                     double[] input_signals,
                                     double true_lbl,
                                     java.util.HashMap p)
        evaluates the partial derivative of the entire network's cost function (as a function of its weights) with respect to the weight variable whose weight is given by the value of the weights array in the given index.
        Specified by:
        evalPartialDerivativeB in interface FFNNCostFunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        weights - double[] all variables (including biases) array
        index - int the index of the partial derivative to take
        input_signals - double[] the input signals for the network (an instance of the training data)
        true_lbl - double the true label corresponding to the input_signals vector
        p - HashMap
        Returns:
        double

      • evalPartialDerivativeB

        public double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] weights,
                                     int index,
                                     double[] input_signals,
                                     double true_lbl,
                                     int num_insts)
        same as evalPartialDerivativeB(weights, index, input_signals, true_lbl, p) but uses the thread-local grad-vector caches instead of the last deriv cache (also uses the last-eval thread-local cache)
        Specified by:
        evalPartialDerivativeB in interface FFNNCostFunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        weights - double[] all variables (including biases) array
        index - int the index of the partial derivative to take
        input_signals - double[] the input signals for the network (an instance of the training data)
        true_lbl - double the true label corresponding to the input_signals vector
        num_insts - int the number of training instances
        Returns:
        double

      • evalPartialDerivativeB

        public double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] d_per_instance)
        computes the partial derivative of this function on an array of values that is the derivative of this function on a set of training instances and labels.
        Specified by:
        evalPartialDerivativeB in interface FFNNCostFunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        d_per_instance - double[] must have been computed from calls to evalPartialDerivativeB(wgts,ind,train_inst,train_lbl,p).
        Returns:
        double
